meanings.definition: For all future time; for always.
meanings.sent1: She promised to love him forever.
meanings.sent2: The stars will shine forever in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The little girl declared she would eat ice cream forever if she could.
meanings.sent4: His words of wisdom will echo forever in our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The bond between the two friends was as strong as if it would last forever.

meanings.sent1: The clock ticked forever in the silent room.
meanings.sent2: The river flowed forever, never stopping its journey.
meanings.sent3: The puppy chased its tail forever, never catching it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang forever in his ears, a melody of joy.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered forever through the trees, a constant companion.

meanings.definition: For an indefinitely long period of time.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins stood forever in the desert, a testament to the past.
meanings.sent2: The old oak tree seemed to stretch forever into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick kept the audience guessing forever.
meanings.sent4: The secret was buried forever in the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The melody played by the musician lingered forever in the air, haunting yet beautiful.
